body: Make a frozen stock of subcultures of _Candida albicans_ at -80°C in Sabroud Dextrose Broth containing 15% glycerol.
Plate cultures on Sabouraud dextrose agar plates and grow at 37 °C for 24 hours. The plates can be stored at 4 °C for a maximum of 4 weeks.
Before each experiment, pick a colony from a plate and grow in 5 ml of Sabouraud Dextrose Broth in a 14 ml conical tube at 37 °C for 24 hours in a shaker.
Centrifuge the cells \(1000 rpm for 5 minutes) and wash the pellet twice with 5 ml of sterile PBS and resuspend in PBS.
Count the cell number using a hemocytometer, and then adjust to the desired concentration.
Inject 2-5 × 10<sup>5</sup> colony-forming units of _C albicans_ dissolved in 200 μl of sterile PBS from tail vein to induce disseminated candidiasis.
